protocol.title: Next generation shotgun library preparation for Illumina sequencing - low volume

source.description:
Take your DNA extractions from
and thaw on ice - spin down on bench spinner.
Optional: Measure DNA concentration of your DNA extractions with Qubit (see Qubit protocol).

Optional: Based on the DNA concentrations adjust the samples to ~equal ng for library prep.
The input volume is
of DNA. The input range in ng can be
to

source.body:
The input amount is not as critical hence step 3 is optional and if too much DNA is added it will be washed away in the downstream steps. As low as 2.5 ng input DNA for some samples created a successful library.
If low biomass samples are handled initial quantification is advisable to maximize success.

source.description:
Take Bead linked transposons (BLT) and Tagmentation buffer (TB1) out of the fridge to bring them to room temperature for ~
.
Prepare 300 ug/mL proteinase K
Thaw KAPA HiFi 2X Ready Mix on ice, invert to mix and spin on a bench spinner

Thaw and dilute Kapa F/R primers to
, on ice.
You will need
of each per 96-samples.
Enter tagmentation protocol on thermal cycler (save as TAGflex):

Thaw the i5 and i7 indexes on ice.
Index stocks should be diluted to
working stocks

of each per reaction

source.body:
Index tubes: spin down briefly (do not vortex as they are small DNA fragments)
Index plates: spin down at 1500 rpm to ensure no droplets remain on the plate cover

source.description: Enter tagmentation stop protocol on the thermal cyclers (save as TAGstop)
Enter PCR protocol on thermal cycler (save as flexPCR)
Enter and save the protK protocol on the thermal cyclers (save as protK) for running the proteinase K reaction.

Add
of DNA of all the samples to a 96 well plate. If less than 5 ul is used add the remaining volume as nuclease free water.

Seal and spin down the plate with the DNA <
to ensure DNA is pelleted in the bottom of the wells

Make the tagmentation master mix (TMM)

Vortex BLT vigorously before use and ensure the beads are evenly resuspended
TMM contains
BLT and
TB1 per reaction.
For 96 samples it is good to use 110 ul BLT and 110 ul TB1.

source.body: Keep the beads in the TMM mixed at all times

source.description:
Pre-load
of TMM per well in an 8-strip of PCR tubes to use for easy aliquoting into the 96-well plate with DNA samples. Make sure TMM is well mixed before aliquoting and distributing it into the wells with the DNA.

Add
of TMM to each DNA well using an 8-channel pipette and mix by pipetting gently ten times to fully mix.

source.body: If beads are adhered to the top or side of the 96-well plate, briefly centrifuge and fully resuspend the bead pellet by pipetting until thoroughly mixed

source.description:
Seal the plate with a PCR plate cover, place in a thermal cycler, and run the TAGflex program.
    2. Proceed immediately to the next steps upon completion of the TAGflex cycle

While waiting for the TAGflex program, preload
of Tagmentation stop buffer (TSB) into each tube of a 8 strip PCR tube for easy aliquoting.

Gently remove the plate seal from 96-well plate and add
TSB into each tagmentation reaction using an 8-channel pipette
Mix by gently pipetting the entire volume, ensuring the beads are fully resuspend
Seal the plate, place in a thermal cycler, and run the TAGstop program

Remove plate seal and place the plate on a 96-well plate magnet for
or until solution is clear
Carefully remove the supernatant using an 8-channel pipette without disturbing the beads, change tips between rows

source.body: The following 2 steps (24 and 25 1.) can be done sequentially by row while on the magnet to ensure that the beads are not drying out. This is in particular useful if you have a lot of samples.

source.description:
Load
(for 96 reactions) Tagmentation wash buffer (TWB) into a sterile reservoir to pipette from

Add
TWB to each well using an 8-channel pipette.
2. Remove the plate from the magnetic stand . Mix by gently pipetting (slowly, to minimize foaming) until beads are
fully resuspended, pipette up and down at least 10 times
3. Ensure beads are submerged in TWB at all times

source.body: More TWB might be needed to ensure that the beads will be submerged.

source.description:
Place the plate on the magnetic stand for
or until solution is clear

Repeat steps 24-26 for a total of two washes and finally resuspend the bead pellet in
TWB. Pipet at least 10x until beads are fully resuspended. Seal the plate and keep on the magnet until step 30.
Make sure beads are submerged in TWB otherwise add more.

Prepare PCR master mix on ice.
Per reaction (i.e. in case of 96 samples calculate for 120) you will need:
nuclease free water
Kapa F primer
Kapa R primer
Kapa Hifi Ready Mix

For 96 samples pre-load
of PCR master mix into 8 strip PCR tubes.

The following steps can be done row by row to avoid excessive drying of beads and easier resuspension.
1.Remove the TWB wash buffer from the samples from step 27 while on the magnet.
2. Immediately add
of PCR master mix to each well to avoid drying out the beads
3. After all rows received master mix, take the plate off the magnet and mix by pipetting up and down until beads are fully resuspended.

Add
of
i5 and i7 barcodes each.
Set a P10 to 10 ul and pipette to mix.
Then seal the plate and spin down briefly.

source.body:
Each well will receive a different barcode combination of i5 and i7. Both indexes will be added in equimolar amounts to each well as a total of 2.5 ul (i5= 1.25 ul + i7 =1.25 ul for each well).
It is recommended to design a plate map to keep track of the barcode combinations and to ensure that each well (sample) has a unique barcodes combination!

source.description: Transfer PCR plate into PCR thermocycler and run the "flexPCR" program.

While the PCR is running pre-load 8 strip PCR tubes with
of
proteinase K

Remove the PCR plate from the thermal cycler and spin down at
for
to ensure that all the liquid is on the bottom of the wells.

The following 4 steps (33, 35-37) are not required if you directly continue to step 39.
Add
of the proteinase K to each well (step 34).
Mix by pipetting 10 ul volume 10 x.
Seal the plate and spin briefly.
Transfer PCR plate to thermal cycler and run the "protK" program.

If stopping at this point seal the plate with sealing foil for PCR plates and store at
for up to
.

Place the plate on the magnet for
or until supernatant is clear.
Transfer supernatant into new 96 well plate, avoid the beads.

If equal DNA amounts were started with you can go ahead and take
of each sample and pool into a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube.
Otherwise, quantify each sample using qubit or picogreen to pool equal amounts of DNA here.
Vortex and spin down the pool briefly.

Transfer
of the pool to another 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube, recommended is a low binding microcentrifuge tube.
Store the remaining pool at
in case the size selection needs to be optimized.

Vortex and invert SPB multiple times to ensure full resuspension. To aim for an average fragment size of 300 bp follow the protocol below.
Prepare SPB-MM (mastemix) by mixing
of SPB with
of nuclease free water.
Mix and invert SPB-MM several times.

source.body: The SPB amount in step 43 and step 49 are relevant for the size selection of the library. If the size of the library is not as hoped, for these steps can be repeated with another aliquot of the pool and different amounts of SPB.

source.description:
Add
of SPB-MM to
of the pool from step 43. Mix thoroughly by pipetting up and down several times.
This is a critical step for proper size distribution for the library.

Prepare fresh 80% ethanol.
Thaw Resuspension buffer and bring to RT and vortex.
Equilibrate the sample purification beads (SPB) at RT for
then vortex and invert several times
If the plate was stored spin down the plate for
at
to make sure all the liquid is on the bottom of the well.
Incubate at room temperature for

Place the microcentrifuge tube on a magnetic stand for
or until the supernatant is clear

Transfer
supernatant into a new 1.5mL tube without disturbing the beads
Vortex and invert the SPB (undiluted stock) until thoroughly resuspended

Add
SPB (undiluted stock) to the new 1.5mL microcentrifuge tube containing the supernatant

Pipette
volume up and down ten times to thoroughly mix

Incubate at room temperature for
.

Place the microcentrifuge tube on a magnetic stand for
. or until the supernatant is clear

Warm up the elution buffer RSB at
to increase final library yield
Remove and discard the supernatant from step 52 without disturbing the beads

With the tube on the magnetic stand, add
ethanol without mixing and incubate for
Add enough
ethanol so that the beads are entirely submerged
Pipette to remove the ethanol without disturbing the beads
Repeat steps 55 - 56 one more time for a total of 2 washes
Carefully, remove any excess liquid from the tube using a pipette without disturbing the beads, try your best to remove all liquid!
Air-dry beads on the magnetic stand for ~3-5 min.

Remove the 1.5mL tube from the magnetic stand and add
of warm RSB to the beads
Pipette mix until thoroughly resuspended at least 15 times
Incubate at room temperature on bench for

Place the 1.5mL tube back on the magnetic stand for
or until clear

Transfer
supernatant into a new 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube. Make sure no beads get transferred along with the supernatant.

A subsample can now be submitted for QC: Quantification by qubit and to see the size distribution running the pool on the Bioanalyzer.
If the size distribution is not as hoped for go back to step 42 using some of the remaining pool and adjust the amounts of SPB.

description:
Adapted from: https://www.protocols.io/view/low-volume-methodology-for-nextera-dna-flex-librar-be6rjhd6 and Julio Avelar-Barragan protocol from Katrine Whiteson's lab
Last modified: May 6th, 2021
Objective: To prepare a DNA sequencing library for Illumina sequencing.
This protocol can be done over two days, with a stopping point after PCR amplification.
This protocol presents a low volume methodology for the Illumina DNA Prep Kit (96 Samples). This method increases the number of sequencing libraries which can be generated using each kit from 384 samples (4 x 96-wells) to 864 samples (9 x 96-wells).
